# The `MachineBlockFrequencyInfo` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineblockfrequencyinfo">MachineBlockFrequencyInfo</a> pass uses <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/blockfrequencyinfoimpl">BlockFrequencyInfoImpl</a> implementation to estimate machine basic block frequencies. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::MachineBlockFrequencyInfo</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineblockfrequencyinfo">MachineBlockFrequencyInfo</a> pass uses <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/blockfrequencyinfoimpl">BlockFrequencyInfoImpl</a> implementation to estimate machine basic block frequencies.

Definition at line 34 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machineblockfrequencyinfo-h">MachineBlockFrequencyInfo.h</a>.

### getBlockFreq() {#a7dd7fa8c0a91118934b08b516b6e9d37}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>BlockFrequency MachineBlockFrequencyInfo::getBlockFreq (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &#42; MBB) const</>}>
getblockFreq - Return block frequency.

Return 0 if we don&#39;t have the information. Please note that initial frequency is equal to 1024. It means that we should not rely on the value itself, but only on the comparison to the other block frequencies. We do this to avoid using of floating points. For example, to get the frequency of a block relative to the entry block, divide the integral value returned by this function (the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/blockfrequency/#a8e9ed6b20c2503f66f1fd0725297aedc">BlockFrequency::getFrequency()</a> value) by <a href="#aa9c041cb61532576659d652739439acc">getEntryFreq()</a>.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machineblockfrequencyinfo-h/#l00066">66</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machineblockfrequencyinfo-h">MachineBlockFrequencyInfo.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machineblockfrequencyinfo-cpp/#l00268">268</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machineblockfrequencyinfo-cpp">MachineBlockFrequencyInfo.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getBlockFreqRelativeToEntryBlock() {#a9be2cffeaf9bda65c4c49eeebaa5458f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>double llvm::MachineBlockFrequencyInfo::getBlockFreqRelativeToEntryBlock (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &#42; MBB) const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Compute the frequency of the block, relative to the entry block.

This API assumes <a href="#aa9c041cb61532576659d652739439acc">getEntryFreq()</a> is non-zero.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machineblockfrequencyinfo-h/#l00070">70</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machineblockfrequencyinfo-h">MachineBlockFrequencyInfo.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getEntryFreq() {#aa9c041cb61532576659d652739439acc}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="BlockFrequency MachineBlockFrequencyInfo::getEntryFreq () const">
Divide a block&#39;s <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/blockfrequency/#a8e9ed6b20c2503f66f1fd0725297aedc">BlockFrequency::getFrequency()</a> value by this value to obtain the entry block - relative frequency of said block.

### view() {#a0fffc1a69ef51a1f23e7e5026b7e5733}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void MachineBlockFrequencyInfo::view (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp; Name, bool isSimple=<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/basicaliasanalysis-cpp/#af6d5cafbdfc5313e65d990120021a3ec">true</a>) const</>}>
Pop up a ghostview window with the current block frequency propagation rendered using dot.
